definition: to guess
three-stroke form of Kangxi radical 94 犬[quan3]
abbr. for 青海[Qing1 hai3], Qinghai Province
green/blue/black/youth/young (of people)
to guess/to conjecture/to surmise
to try to answer a question (in a quiz, guessing game, riddle etc)/quiz game
to guess/to conjecture/to suppose/to suspect
to suspect/to have misgivings/suspicious/misgivings
to guess correctly/to figure out the right answer
to be suspicious and jealous of
to be unable to guess or make out
innocent playmates
finger-guessing game/rock-paper-scissors game/morra
to make a wild guess/blind guess
to surmise/to conjecture
the Goldbach conjecture in number theory
pinyin: Ge1 de2 ba1 he4 cai1 xiang3

definition: suspicion
unsuspecting/innocent and without apprehension
to have sufficient insight to perceive/to suspect that ...

sentences.english: You don't need me to explain the luck, I guess.
sentences.chinese: 關於幸運之神眷顧，我猜完全用不着解釋了。
我猜，這樣做的人並不多。

sentences.english: I said; `that's your father's tale, too, I suppose.'
sentences.chinese: 我說，“我猜那也是你父親編出來的故事。”

sentences.english: Well,I suppose one possibility would be to say the guy in New York is Napoleon.
sentences.chinese: 我猜其中一個可能性會是，紐約傢伙是拿破崙。

sentences.english: A secure, memorable password is easy for you to remember, and hard for others to guess.
sentences.chinese: 安全可靠又難以遺忘的密碼應該是易記且難猜的。

sentences.english: Neither do you want to enable these options, I guess.
sentences.chinese: 我猜，你也不想要以下這些選項吧。

sentences.english: I didn't recall talking about sneakers, but it was possible, I guess.
sentences.chinese: 我沒有記得說過軟底鞋，但它是可能的，我猜。

sentences.english: I should guess his age at 50.
Yeah, do you know what type of people often come to visit Yangmingshan these days?
sentences.chinese: 嗯，你猜現在經常來陽明山的是哪些人？

sentences.english: Does anyone have a guess for v?
So I guess he is what they call "natural late talker".
sentences.chinese: 所以我猜他是他們所謂的“語遲者”。

sentences.english: Well, I guess I should've known. He just kept making me watch Moulin Rouge.
sentences.chinese: 嗯，我早就該猜到了他總是強迫我看《紅磨坊》。

sentences.english: Lisa out to explain to the qin guess, hope he put down the prejudice against the exhibition.
sentences.chinese: 塔利莎出去向秦猜解釋，希望他放下對阿展的偏見。

sentences.english: Xiao Hong likes guessing riddles written on lanterns most.
and you may have even guessed that it's the real face behind Design, LLC.
sentences.chinese: 你甚至可能猜到設計有限責任公司背後的真面目。

sentences.english: Part of the lantern festival tradition involves a game to guess riddles attached to the lanterns.
sentences.chinese: 元宵節傳統習俗中還有一部分是關於猜燈謎的遊戲。

definition: to guess correctly/to figure out the right answer
to guess/to conjecture/to suppose/to suspect
to make a wild guess/blind guess
pretty close/very near/about right
to guess/to conjecture/to surmise
Correct!/Oh, that's right, ... (when one suddenly remembers sth one wanted to mention)/Oh, by the way, ...
to be unable to guess or make out
(usually used in the negative) to answer or reply to sb's question
anyway/in any case/to come over from the enemy's side
to keep listeners in suspense (in storytelling)/to keep people on tenterhooks
to know
right or wrong?/Is it right?/OK, yes? (colloquial)
(onom.) laughing out loud
to bet/to make a bet/a wager
needless to say/it goes without saying
riddle
see 謎兒|谜儿[mei4 r5], riddle
